subject: Personal Finance
title: Savers vs Borrowers
description: Learn Savers vs Borrowers in one minute.

hook.text: Inflation punishes savers and rewards borrowers. Your savings shrink while your debts do too.

buildup.text: $10,000 in savings loses purchasing power every year. At 3% inflation, it buys 26% less in a decade.

discovery.text: But a $200,000 mortgage feels lighter over time. You repay with dollars that are worth less.

twist.text: This is why governments with massive debt quietly prefer moderate inflation. It shrinks the debt.

climax.text: The US national debt from WWII was largely 'inflated away' over the following decades.

punchline.text: Inflation is a hidden tax on savers.

quiz.question: Who benefits from inflation?
options: Borrowers, because they repay with cheaper dollars
